title: Slovak language
summary: Slovak (/ˈsloʊvæk, -vɑːk/[5][6]) is a West Slavic language of the Czech–Slovak group, written in Latin script.[7] It is part of the Indo-European language family, and is one of Slavic languages, which are part of a larger Balto-Slavic branch. Spoken by approximately 5 million people as a native language, primarily ethnic Slovaks, it serves as the official language of Slovakia and one of the 24 official languages of the European Union.
